result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Gabriel N Perez in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request a resolution date.
Defense to file plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing date. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
 Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building. 


 .  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Gabriel N Perez in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel was recently appointed.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Gabriel N Perez not in court, defendant in custody.  
Case set for status following 22CF1484. Matter is adjourned to Br. 45.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LAS; NMV
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gabriel N Perez in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Gabriel N Perez in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gabriel N Perez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  AS TO COUNT 8:  Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
